Hello RUSD Families,

We understand that PG&E (Pacific Gas and Electric Company) has indicated power outages may occur in our area in order to avoid strain on power grids caused by extreme temperatures. Please know that your students’ attendance will not be affected because of any absences due to this inconvenience.

If a power outage occurs during school hours and it impacts your ability to access distance learning please contact your child’s school and your child will be given an excused absence. Please contact your child’s teacher for instructions/information about making up any important work. This applies to students in Distance Learning and Rocklin Virtual Campus (RVC).

For more information on PG&E power outages in your area, please visit https://www.pge.com/en_US/residential/outages/planning-and-preparedness/safety-and-preparedness/keep-power-on.page

Thank you,
Rocklin Unified School District

We just emailed this note to all our RUSD families. In case you missed it:

If you are picking up or have already received your Chromebook, here is the correct way to make it work:

When you turn on your Chromebook you might see a message that reads: 'this Chromebook is disabled.’ That message will go away as soon as you connect to WiFi. If that message doesn't disappear within 10-15 seconds, simply restart your Chromebook.

If you still have issues or have any questions please contact the RUSD Service Desk at https://support.rocklinusd.org or (916) 672-3600.

Thanks to all of you for your patience and suggestions/feedback. We appreciate it!

Locations: Rocklin High School (5301 Victory Lane) and Whitney High School (701 Wildcat Boulevard)

Rocklin Unified School District will continue to provide free meals for anyone under age 18 (including ages 18-22 transition students) through Friday, August 7th.

DAYS: Monday, August 3, 2020, to Friday, August 7, 2020
TIMES: 11:30am - 12:30pm
Locations: Rocklin High School (5301 Victory Lane) and Whitney High School (701 Wildcat Boulevard)

Note: Families can access these schools regardless of their school of residence. You must be 18 years or younger and must be present to receive meals. Adult Transition students (18-22 years old) also qualify. One breakfast and one lunch will be available both for pick-up and via "drive-thru" at the sites' bus loop.

Thank you to the outstanding RUSD Nutrition Services team for providing this program to Rocklin Unified students!

For more information click here: http://www.schoolnutritionandfitness.com/index.php?sid=2710081939036719

post_text: What do you do when you can't celebrate a birthday at school? Last week Tori Hayes, Jenny Sneed, Tera Carter, Andrea Opel, Lauren Cullen, Kevin Seals, Stella Mahaffey, Richard Rehhaut, and their families from Spring View Middle School brought the birthday celebration to one of their students at home! Check out the heartwarming video below! #RUSDProud
shared_text:
Debby Wells is celebrating friendship with Tori Hayes and Brenda Dunn.
April 1 at 3:53 PM ·

Today I was moved to tears by David's amazing teacher, Tori Hayes, aid Lauren Cullen and fellow teachers and parents at Spring View Middle School. A caravan of 10 cars drove into our cul-de-sac today to wish Dave a Happy 13th Birthday. They had signs on their cars, balloons and sang to him from their vans - Happy Birthday the Social Distancing way . Our neighbors came out and enjoyed watching the fun too.
He was so overjoyed and laughed and cried... he just wanted to show everyone his Cosmo Robot, maybe next time. (LOL) You can tell I am very excited and filled with emotion... We were blessed by these wonderful people who took time out to do a kindness to my family... at a time when it was truthfully much-needed. I hope anyone who see's this, can go out and do something to make another person as happy as these wonderful people made us.
